body:
Thanks for reporting. We have an issue in the 1.5 release which has been
fixed. Can you try the nightlies (1.5.1-SNAPSHOT) together with the latest
RoboVM nightlies?
On Dec 16, 2014 2:18 PM, "longjie1986" notifications@github.com wrote:

> Hi:
> I have use the libgdx1.5.0 to generate a default project and package it
> with Robovm Tools. when install done, I start the app , it can be start
> up,and the bad logic picture shows with red background, and do nothing,
> about 4 or 5 minutes, the app quit itself, I can not figure out why this
> happen, and there is no problem with the Simulator. Someone encounter this?
> Here is the software config:
> 
> Eclipse:4.4.1
> Java: Java SE 8(1.8.0)
> libgdx: 1.5.0
> robovm: 1.0.0-beta
> Android: 5.0
> Ipad Air: 7.0.4
> 
> Because I have no idea of how to analysis the crash, I just attach
> them,here is the crash log
>

> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/2649.

Yep, it looks like the CMMotion issue.

Regarding crash analysis: You have to find the symbolication script from Xcode, use that on your crash log, and make sure the .app and .dsym files compiled by RoboVM are accessible to the script (findable via mdfind).

The whole process is described here:
https://github.com/robovm/robovm/wiki/Symbolicate-a-crash-reports
and here:
http://iostechblog.wordpress.com/2013/08/28/symbolicating-crash-logs/

Experienced the same crash recently. But as the issue is probably the CMMotion crash, try with the latest snapshots/nightlies first.

Also, if it stills crashes, try clearing your caches before building (cache under ~/.gradle/ and in your workspace/project dir at least)

See my issue in RoboVM where you can see a symbolicated crash log of this crash:
https://github.com/robovm/robovm/issues/647

I have delete the cache dir unser ~/.gradle/  and update the version of gdx and robovm:
gdxVersion = '1.5.1-SNAPSHOT'
roboVMVersion = '1.0.0-SNAPSHOT'
the robovm plugin is  http://download.robovm.org/nightlies/eclipse/site.xml
I do not know how to delete the cache in my workspace/project, so I just clean the project with eclipse tools.
But I'm unlucky, it can not solve the crash problem.

You also need to clean the .robovm directory in your user home directory.
I'll see if i can reproduce it on my end with the lastest snapshots.
On Dec 17, 2014 1:41 PM, "longjie1986" notifications@github.com wrote:

> I have delete the cache dir unser ~/.gradle/ and update the version of gdx
> and robovm:
> gdxVersion = '1.5.1-SNAPSHOT'
> roboVMVersion = '1.0.0-SNAPSHOT'
> the robovm plugin is http://download.robovm.org/nightlies/eclipse/site.xml
> I do not know how to delete the cache in my workspace/project, so I just
> clean the project with eclipse tools.
> But I'm unlucky, it can not solve the crash problem.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/2649#issuecomment-67316691.
Can't reproduce, tested thoroughly with latest versions.

on device?
On Dec 17, 2014 2:47 PM, "Tomski" notifications@github.com wrote:

> Can't reproduce, tested thoroughly with latest versions.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/2649#issuecomment-67323888.
More reports of this still an issue in the irc. Im yet to replicate, running apps that just generate garbage for 30mins+. Maybe I am just lucky?

I'd guess people didn't properly update all the things. I'll give it a try
tomorrow.
On Dec 17, 2014 8:23 PM, "Tomski" notifications@github.com wrote:

> More reports of this still an issue in the irc. Im yet to replicate,
> running apps that just generate garbage for 30mins+. Maybe I am just lucky?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/2649#issuecomment-67377299.
I can reproduce it with latest nightly of everything (libgdx, robovm, robovm plugin). Seems like we leak memory like mad. Looking for a fix.

Well, turns out things crash due to an issue with blocks. Will bring it up
with Niklas and see what goes.
On Dec 17, 2014 8:24 PM, "Mario Zechner" badlogicgames@gmail.com wrote:

> I'd guess people didn't properly update all the things. I'll give it a try
> tomorrow.
> On Dec 17, 2014 8:23 PM, "Tomski" notifications@github.com wrote:
> 
> > More reports of this still an issue in the irc. Im yet to replicate,
> > running apps that just generate garbage for 30mins+. Maybe I am just lucky?
> > 
> > —
> > Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> > https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/2649#issuecomment-67377299.

Similar issue, my simulator spits out the following error:

```
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: java.lang.Thread.<init>(Ljava/lang/ThreadGroup;Ljava/lang/Runnable;Ljava/lang/String;)V
    at java.lang.Daemons$Daemon.start(Daemons.java)
    at java.lang.Daemons.start(Daemons.java)
rvmStartup(...) failed!
```

No, this is a different issue. Clean your RoboVM cache and make sure you
use versions of libGDX, RoboVM (buil.gradle) and the RoboVM Eclipse plugin
that are compatible.
On Dec 18, 2014 12:45 PM, "Dennis Ruhe" notifications@github.com wrote:

> Similar issue, my simulator spits out the following error:
> 
> java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: java.lang.Thread.<init>(Ljava/lang/ThreadGroup;Ljava/lang/Runnable;Ljava/lang/String;)V
>     at java.lang.Daemons$Daemon.start(Daemons.java)
>     at java.lang.Daemons.start(Daemons.java)
> rvmStartup(...) failed!
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/2649#issuecomment-67475283.

According to /versions.html they should be compatible (1.5.0, 1.0.0-beta-01). Only thing is that I use the nightly eclipse plugin as I have eclipse 4.4.x

EDIT: Clearing cache fixed it, thanks. Feel free to remove my/our comments on this issue

@tomski Niklas identified the issue in RoboVM. I can fix it there, but there are other problems with using CoreMotion (GC). Could you revert the changes so we use UIAccelerometer again? Let's also disable the compass for the time being, until we resolve the issues on the RoboVM side. I'd like to do a release as 1.5.0 is currently broken on iOS irrespective of the RoboVM version.
Can do, just need to backport UIAccelerometer yes?. What is the plan for the future regarding CM? It is ever going to viable?

Ya, just backport UIAccel. We can keep the coremition code as long, just
not execute it. CM will be viable, not sure how we can fix the GC issue
with that one yet though.
On Dec 18, 2014 3:06 PM, "Tomski" notifications@github.com wrote:

> Can do, just need to backport UIAccelerometer yes?. What is the plan for
> the future regarding CM? It is ever going to viable?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/2649#issuecomment-67489669.
Great, Ill just comment it out and leave a note.

Thanks! We are working on the RoboVM issues. After that we need to figure
out how not produce tons of garbage :)
 On Dec 18, 2014 4:09 PM, "Tomski" notifications@github.com wrote:

> Closed #2649 https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/2649 via eabcb7e
> https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/commit/eabcb7ee160bac4ca0dbfd3f208b9cf77cb75d01
> .
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/2649#event-209619418.

issue.title: App not resume after press home button iOS 8.1.2 (black screen)
issue.body:
I have posted this in robovm but this seem libgdx issue.

I use robovm 1.0 beta 1 and libgdx 1.5.0. After press home button my iPad Mini 2 iOS 8.1.2 it can not resume (press home button and then click app icon), it just show black screen. This not occur with robovm 1.0 alpha 4 and libgdx 1.4.1
